intro: Cheiranthus syrticola, commonly known as the Syrticola mustard, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Cheiranthus syrticola plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
